intro: Rhaponticoides linaresii, commonly known as the Linares' rhaponticoid, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. It is known for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in some regions.
